results.title: CTO (Chief Technology Officer)
results.description:
Looking for a stable yet dynamic and energetic job? Want to do things that really matter? What a coincidence.

We‚Äôre Telemedi - a trusted partner in advanced digital healthcare solutions. What we do is ultimately save lives. And yes, those are big words. But we do put faith in them, and we conduct our business with this particular goal in mind.

How do we achieve that?

We work in 20+ global markets, providing high-quality services of remote doctor consultations - over 100,000 per month, conducted by 500+ GPs. We implement digital healthcare solutions for insurance, assistance, healthcare, and finance. We build our leverage on AI, automated triage, and medical monitoring devices. We aim to lead the change that the world is currently facing.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

We offer good salaries. We enable you to work remotely in full. We give you unlimited access to all our remote doctor consultations. But what‚Äôs most important is our culture. Here at Telemedi we seek and encourage honest, mutual feedback, ownership, and drive for growth and improvement. And yes - you truly can speak your mind and be taken seriously.

¬†

Responsibilties:

  • Business reporting: Report and analyze data from IT department

Requirements

  • ‚ÄúGetting things done‚Äù attitude - love for challenges and love for seeing the results! Getting stuff done!

Benefits

results.title: Business Analyst - Healthcare Revenue Cycle
results.description:
At Janus, we believe in a world where healthcare functions efficiently. Join us on our mission to improve the lives of administrative workers and fundamentally change the way work is done. Our team is building a world-class process improvement platform to help healthcare providers generate more cash with fewer resources.

We are looking for a Business Analyst with Revenue Cycle expertise to join our team! This person will be responsible for product design requirements gathering and streamlining of discovery for product enhancement activities. The Business Analyst will facilitate discovery sessions, create product build specifications, and confirm business case associated with product build or enhancement activities. This person will coordinate with cross functional teams including engineering, product, and customer success to confirm complete and comprehensive requirements for all product designs. A successful candidate will have high attention to detail, an appreciation for consistent documentation, an ability to creatively solve complete customer problems, and strong communication to coordinate amongst various teams.

This person will be an individual contributor within our Product team and should have a strong sense of autonomy in their individual tasks such as:

  • Independently facilitates discovery and design sessions for new complex build activities including new automation use cases or enhancements to existing functionality using best practices for automation design and development
  • Documents detailed specification for new build activities and confirms understanding of design with engineering, customer success, and product delivery teams
  • Maintains specification documentation in accessible and centrally located documentation system
  • Assists in the creation of automation design documents to support business decision-making, process streamlining, automation development and performance improvement to meet business and customer needs
  • Creates business case for build activity including defining inputs for value and success measure tracking in collaboration with customer success team
  • Partners with engineers and project managers to create timelines of automation development and business validation to leadership
  • Supports research through ongoing database investigation to confirm enhancement requirements or other data needs
  • Communicates clearly, timely and professionally, both in writing and verbally
  • Independently problem solves to remove blockers, identify risks and create mitigation plans, and escalate timely
  • Manages and guides cross functional team meetings to ensure discovery and design needs are met for ongoing product success
  • Facilitates activities with customer and internal teams as needed
  • Applies critical thinking to solve customer and internal problems
  • Identifies and escalates risks with proposed solutions and suggested recommendations
  • Serves as an active team member; participates in department and company wide initiatives; contributes to the overall culture
  • Other duties as assigned by Product Leadership

Requirements

  • 3+ years of Healthcare Revenue Cycle or Business Analyst work experience in a technical or customer facing role; must feel comfortable in the details
  • Preferred database design experience in analytical tools such as SQL, Tableau etc.
  • Preferred certification in Lean Six Sigma Green or Black Belt, CRCR
  • Self-motivated, persuasive, and proactive team player with innovative ideas to inspire team members
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Proven experience building strong internal relationships and collaborate with cross-functional teams
  • Detail-oriented, organized and process-driven, without losing sight of the bigger picture
  • Consistent ability to produce relevant documentation of procedures and testing approaches
  • Ability to suggest improvements and dig deep into optimizing and streamlining processes
  • Critical thinking skills to problem solve creatively within Janus technology suite
  • Comfort in technical planning and documentation tools such as Jira, Confluence, and Microsoft Teams
  • Flexibility and comfort working in a dynamic and constantly changing environment of an early-stage startup
  • Has fun, celebrates success, and contributes to a positive culture
  • Ability to work remotely in the United States

Benefits

  • 100% Company Paid Medical for employee coverage & a generous contribution for dependent coverage.
  • Unlimited PTO which is actually used! Take the time you need to be successful.
  • Employee Stock Options because we are building something together and want to share in the value we create
  • Work when and where you need with our flexible schedules and environments.
  • Save for your retirement with a 401k plan


Inclusivity

At Janus, we're committed to growing and empowering an inclusive community within our company and communities. This is why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives across our organization. We are an equal opportunities employer and encourage everyone to apply for our available positions, even if they don't meet every requirement ‚Äî including women, people of color, individuals with disabilities and those in the LGBTQIA+ community.


We are the Shapers of Culture
Our employees are our greatest asset, and we are passionate about creating strong culture with deep purpose. We are entrepreneurial and focused, yet humble, empathetic, and inclusive. We value the individual and tackle problems as a team. The best idea wins, and teams celebrate together. We are remote-first, well-funded, and growing fast!

We pride ourselves on being true to ourselves and authentic. We stand on the following tenets:

  • Ownership - everyone is a contributor and is empowered to drive improvement.
  • Curiosity - playing and learning every day.
  • Eagerness - demolishing barriers to building and innovating.
  • Radical Transparency - openness in communication and decision making across the organization.
  • Partnership over Profit - prioritizing long-term relationships.
  • Humility - we strive to be team players, setting aside ego.
  • Community - nurturing an environment where all employees and partners can thrive.

Our team is fun, innovative, and willing to roll-up our sleeves to help each other succeed in a fast-paced environment.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned.

This job description does not constitute a contract of employment and Janus Health Technologies, Inc. may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.

results.title: Onboarding & Customer Success Specialist
results.description:

We value all different kinds of experience, so even if you feel you don't meet all of the necessary criteria for this position, we encourage you to apply.

What is DISCO?

Today we count UMG, Sony, Warner Music, Netflix, Amazon and Rockstar Games among our customers, and over 250,000 people interact with DISCO each month. To apply for this incredible position, please submit your resume along with a cover letter.

DISCO is an equal-opportunity employer. In addition, we will provide reasonable accommodations for individuals who have disabilities. If you require any reasonable accommodation to participate in the application process, please note this in your cover letter and we will reach out to you.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:

#LI-REMOTE¬†

results.title: Sales Operations - SMB
results.description:
About Burq

Burq started with an ambitious mission: how can we turn the complex process of offering delivery into a simple turnkey solution.

We started with building the largest network of delivery networks, partnering with some of the biggest delivery companies. We then made it extremely easy for businesses to plug into our network and start offering delivery to their customers. Now, we‚Äôre powering deliveries for some of the fastest-growing companies from retailers to startups.

It‚Äôs a big mission and now we want you to join us to make it even bigger! üöÄ

We‚Äôre already backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists, including Village Global, the fund whose investors include Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, Reid Hoffman, and Sara Blakely. We have assembled a world-class team all over the U.S.

We operate at scale, but we're still a small team relative to the opportunity. We have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to grow while doing the most important work of your career.

We want people who are unafraid to be wrong and support decisions with numbers and narrative. Here‚Äôs a quick overview of what you will be doing:


Sales Operations Analyst

As the Sales Operations Analyst at Burq, you will work closely with our Sales team and leadership to optimize current processes, assist with strategic outreach, create and manage campaigns, and use a data-driven approach to track success of projects and strategic initiatives. You will be part of an emerging team that is helping our clients optimize their delivery operations, and have an immediate impact as the first employee dedicated to this function at a fast-growing, early-stage startup.

What You'll Do

  • Be one of the first 20 people in a growing company on an amazing team Provide strategic and operational support to our Account Executives
  • Implement new tools and manage existing tech stacks for sales/marketing, and build new processes and frameworks to ensure optimal efficiency for our business functions
  • Create a database of prospects, maintain existing CRM, and build campaigns to target existing and prospective customers
  • Research and develop data-driven approaches to define and measure success criteria for strategic initiatives and internal productivity
  • Work cross-functionally to understand the current needs within each department and build solutions to remove bottlenecks and scale our internal operations

Requirements

Who You Are

  • Ability to define projects, measure success, test assumptions against outcomes and collect and incorporate feedback
  • Experience with collaborating cross-functionally with sales, customer success, and operations teams
  • Excited to develop sales outreach strategies, define metrics to track success, research and build out lists of companies to target, and designing and building campaigns
  • Have a go-getter attitude and thrive in the startup environment - you are not shy to experiment with new concepts and use data to validate the success of your designs
  • Previous experience with CRM platforms, automated outreach tools, ticketing systems, and data analytics dashboard platforms (or strong interest to learn with an affinity for learning new tools)

  • Are a skilled listener & with excellent verbal and written communications

Benefits

About the Team

Owners: We hire a smaller number of high-quality, talented individuals and trust their judgment.

Builders: We are a very early-stage startup, which means there is an endless amount of opportunity to build! We value transparency and cross-collaboration when trying out new strategies, testing new ideas, and giving/receiving feedback.

Velocity: We move fast and with intention. We believe in transparency across our team in order to maintain our velocity and ensure we are not losing focus on the company. mission and vision

Long-Term Thinking: As a small startup, there are endless opportunities that we can tackle in our industry. To ensure we effectively scale and continue to be a market leader, we keep our team focused on our critical initiatives, and provide every team member with full-autonomy over their work in order to meet our long-term goals.

Benefits: We believe in investing heavily in our employees, and provide the below benefits to our team members:

  • Competitive compensation packages, including salary and equity options
  • Remote-First work environment
  • Generous PTO

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: At Burq, we value diversity and take providing our diverse workforce with an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, martial status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Senior Java Developer
results.description:
Description

About Masabi:

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work and visit by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company developing a fare collection platform that allows people to buy and present tickets for public transit on their mobile phones or by tapping a bank card or smart card to travel.¬†

¬†

We believe a new fare payments system allowing passengers to tap and ride without needing to buy a ticket or understand fares should be available to every passenger and every transit agency around the globe, without prohibitive costs or taking years to deliver, helping people move seamlessly from A to B.

¬†

Our Justride platform has won numerous awards and is used in over 150 locations worldwide, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, Valencia, The Hague, Los Angeles, Melbourne, and many more. With an exciting industry-first mobile ticketing SDK, we are partnering with companies like Uber, Lyft, Transit, Moovit to enable the purchase of public transit tickets within leading mobility applications.

¬†

Join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.

¬†

¬†

The Role

Masabi is looking for developers to join our expanding Justride Validation team, which is responsible for both the backend server infrastructure powering our ticket validation systems and the software running on the devices in the field. You will be developing the Justride Inspect solution, which has provided ticket inspection and validation solutions for many transit agencies for more than a decade, and you will be working alongside a technically diverse team that have a range of expertise you can learn from.

¬†

Our services need to be extremely reliable - rush hours in big cities depend on them - and performance under heavy load is critical. Software on devices must be reliable and, in a constrained environment, equally performant.

¬†

You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of products, all of which are highly visible to our customers.

¬†

¬†

Location

This role is available in the UK, either in a fully remote model with occasional travel to our London office, or in a hybrid model where you will be allowed to come into our London office as many days per week as you require.¬†

¬†

¬†

About you

  • You will have strong core Java/Kotlin and object-oriented skills, and experience of implementing high-quality high-performance software.
  • Some exposure to any of AWS, mobile development, and large scale operations would be a bonus, but equally valuable is being open to learning about some or all of these. You should also be the kind of developer that challenges the status quo and will be active in evolving our stack.
  • Value collaboration, as you will learn how to excel as a team member by working closely not just with peers and colleagues from different areas of the business.¬†
  • You will adapt to implement high-quality, high-performance software whether it be destined for a cloud server, serverless or on a constrained device.
  • Passionate about technology and customer experiences.
  • Must be approachable, patient and an excellent communicator, a team player.
  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills and make them more effective and productive.

¬†

¬†

Our Stack

  • Java 8+ / Kotlin¬†
  • Gitlab / Bitbucket / Bamboo / Gradle / Maven / Artifactory / Puppet / Docker
  • Cloud hosted, Terraform/Puppet managed, PCI-DSS certified platform infrastructure
  • AWS services used include S3, SQS, CloudFormation, RDS, EC2, Lambda, IoT
  • Native iOS Objective C/Swift, native Android Java/Kotlin, J2ObjC

¬†

¬†

Some of our benefits:

  • Competitive salary package
  • 25 days of holiday per year plus the option to buy another 5 days pro-rated
  • Private Healthcare via AXA including pre-existing conditions and mental health
  • Life Insurance
  • Flexibility to work from home whenever you need to and flexible working hours (we are currently operating fully remote due to COVID-19)
  • You will now also be able to work from any country in the world for up to three months each year (tax laws permitting)
  • Pension scheme
  • Choice of workstation
  • Annual training budget of up to 1000¬£
  • Onsite/video yoga classes
  • Childcare vouchers
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Unlimited snacks and drinks, with regular free lunches (when we‚Äôre in the office)
  • Regular social gatherings with a monthly allowance for each employee (when it‚Äôs safe)

¬†

¬†

Diversity

We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, striving to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. Whoever you are, just be yourself. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply and we don‚Äôt discriminate. Also, please notify our team of any preferred pronouns at any point in your application.¬†

¬†

¬†

Interviewing

In light of the continued Covid-19 risks, all interviews are expected to take place by phone or video.

Our interview process is as follows:

  1. 30‚Äô Recruiter chat
  2. 45‚Äô Manager chat
  3. 90‚Äô Tech Interview
  4. 60‚Äô Culture Interview¬†

¬†

¬†

Remote working

Masabi‚Äôs flexible working policy will allow you to work fully remotely, or from one of our offices in London, Cluj, New York, Denver or Boston. The choice about where you work from will be largely made by you. Regardless of where you choose to work from, you will be allowed to work outside of the country of your employment for up to 3 months each year (tax laws permitting).

¬†

To find out more about who we are and how we work, please have a read about how our business reacted to the Covid pandemic: https://www.masabi.com/2021/08/02/emerging-stronger/

Requirements

None

What You‚Äôll Do:

What You‚Äôll Need to be Successful:

About Darkroom:

A category leader in results-driven growth marketing, Darkroom‚Äôs success is attributed to our unique partnership model, purposefully built to launch brands to market and accelerate growth across direct-to-consumer. results.title: Associate Engineering Manager
results.description:
The Nitty Gritty

Big Viking Games is looking for a Associate Engineering Manager to join our Technology team! Reporting to our Senior Engineering Manager, you'll be working on our flagship games - YoWorld and FishWorld! The ideal candidate will be a seasoned developer with people management experience. This role will be expected to split their time doing hands-on development and people management. This position is offered 100% remotely.

The Duties:

  • Lead, mentor, and manage a team (4-6 developers) focused on live operations for our web based games. This team will be responsible for the game uptime, feature roadmap and tools development for our games - YoWorld and FishWorld.
  • Build and execute development plans, create and deploy best-in-class processes, and proactively identify and resolve issues in partnership with production.
  • Work closely with other verticals - product, design, production and QA, to ensure seamless execution.
  • Actively participate in design and code reviews for the team.
  • Ensure game uptime, solve bugs in liveops environment.
  • Align the team with the company wide technical and business vision. Own all the deliverables from the team.
  • Grow and mentor your team. Advance their skills and careers.
  • Actively participate in recruiting top tech talent for the company in partnership with our recruit team

Requirements

The Must Haves

  • Completed post secondary education in Computer Science or Engineering
  • 3+ years of experience working in a cloud operations environment
  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • 2+ years of full stack development experience
  • 1+ years experience managing technology teams
  • Shipped multiple features and projects in a live ops environment
  • A passion for games!

The Nice to Haves

  • Experience in TypeScript, Java or PHP
  • Ability to write efficient SQL statements and work with databases
  • Experience with Redis, Memcache, Docker, and Ansible would be highly beneficial
  • F2P Game Development experience

Benefits

The Loot:

  • Competitive salary, bonus program, Group Retirement Savings Plan matching, and participation in the Employee Stock Option Plan.
  • Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, and vision), including generous time off policies.
  • Lots of other great perks such as frequent company paid outings, events and get-togethers.

Becoming a Viking:

Are you cut from our cloth? Does the idea of working for a gaming company and doing what you love every day get you so excited you kind of want to scream? Great! Send us your resume and cover letter, along with a link to your portfolio.

Big Viking Games is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Accommodation may be provided in all parts of the hiring process.
